div.p: Mevenide for Eclipse distribution is composed of five different plugins : Core, Config, Grammar, Grabber and UI. They can be found here. Plugin Features are described in this document
Mevenide for Eclipse now supports Eclipse Update feature. To learn how to install Mevenide thanks the EclipseUpdate Manager, please refer to this document.
Older releases can still be found on Sourceforge download page.
The Maven PDE Plugin allows Maven users to generate Eclipse plugin artifacts easily and keep trace of artifact inter-dependency. To install the plugin, follow instructions on the plugin's page .

The Mevenide support for the Netbeans 4.1 + 5.0 IDE recognizes the Maven project type in the IDE, tightly integrating Maven into the IDE, allows to run arbitrary goals, edit project properties etc. The complete list of features can be found here and You might also want to check the User guide which describes the features in more details and is accompanied with screenshots.
The latest release 0.9 can be downloaded in zip format.

Or it can be downloaded using the Netbeans Autoupdate feature. In latest 5.0 development builds, the Mevenide autoupdate server is part of the "Infrastructure/Extra Update Centers" module on the default Netbeans autoupdate server. Alternatively you can download and install this small autoupdate module or create a new Autoupdate server in the Tools/Options dialog with the following URL: http://mevenide.codehaus.org/nbm_release/NBM_AutoUpdate.xml
If you already installed some of the previous releases, updating through Autoupdate is a better option because only the updated modules get downloaded.

ul.li: Netbeans 4.1 or 5.0 beta For 4.0 installation see note below.

div.p: Note: The grammar module (editor completion for maven xml files) in 0.9 release zip will work with Netbeans 4.1. To get it working with 4.0 you need the old 4.0 nbm .
The Maven NBM plugin allows maven users to generate Netbeans modules from their projects. To install the plugin, follow instructions on the plugin's page .
Mevenide for JBuilder distribution can be found here. Plugin Features are described in this document
The Maven JBuilder OpenTool Plugin allows Maven users to generate JBuilder OpenTool artifacts easily. To install the plugin, follow instructions on the plugin's page .
Mevenide IDEA plugin downloads are available in the Mevenide IDEA plugin downloads page. You might also want to view the installation guide.
